info.title: API Explorer
info.description: The entire API V2 documentation is interactive and can be tested here. To the right side of every endpoint you will see a box with an example request. You can click on the "Try it" button to send a request to the server right from the docs. You will need to provide an API key by clicking the `ApiKeyAuth_token` blue text.

def-0.title: Account
def-0.description: An email account that can be used to send campaigns

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the account was created

timestamp_updated.description: Timestamp when the account was last updated

first_name.description: First name associated with the account

last_name.description: Last name associated with the account

limit.description: Email sending limit for the account

warm_ctd.description: Whether the account is in warm CTD mode

open_rate.description: Email open rate for the account

important_rate.description: Important email rate for the account

spam_save_rate.description: Spam save rate for the account

weekday_only.description: Whether to send emails only on weekdays

increment.description: Daily increment for email sending limits

added_by.description: User ID who added the account

modified_by.description: User ID who last modified the account

enable_slow_ramp.description: Whether to enable slow ramp up for sending limits

inbox_placement_test_limit.description: The limit for inbox placement tests

organization.description: Organization ID that owns this account

timestamp_last_used.description: Timestamp when the account was last used

warmup_status.description: Current warmup status of the account

response.example: 550-5.4.5 Daily user sending limit exceeded. For more information on Gmai

e_message.example: error: data command failed: 550-5.4.5 daily user sending limit exceeded

provider_code.description: Provider code for the account. Please make sure to specify the right provider code, otherwise your account will not work.

warmup_pool_id.description: ID of the warmup pool this account belongs to

is_managed_account.description: Whether this is a managed account

dfy_password_changed.description: Whether DFY password has been changed

sending_gap.description: The gap between emails sent from this account in minutes (minimum wait time when used with multiple campaigns)

def-1.title: Campaign
def-1.description: A campaign that can be sent to a list of recipients

sequences.description: List of sequences (the actual email copy). Even though this field is an array, only the first element is used, so please provide only one array item, and add the steps to that array

type.description: Type of step. This has to be 'email' always - it's the only supported type for now

delay.description: The number of days to wait before sending the NEXT email

body.example:
Hey {{firstName}},

I hope you are doing well.

v_disabled.description: Whether this variant is disabled. By default, all the variants are enabled. Please set this to true if you want to disable this variant

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the campaign was created

timestamp_updated.description: Timestamp when the campaign was last updated

email_gap.description: The gap between emails in minutes

random_wait_max.description: The maximum random wait time in minutes

text_only.description: Whether the campaign is text only

email_list.description: List of accounts to use for sending emails

daily_limit.description: The daily limit for sending emails

stop_on_reply.description: Whether to stop the campaign on reply

email_tag_list.description: List of tags to use for sending emails

link_tracking.description: Whether to track links in emails

open_tracking.description: Whether to track opens in emails

stop_on_auto_reply.description: Whether to stop the campaign on auto reply

daily_max_leads.description: The daily maximum new leads to contact

match_lead_esp.description: Whether to match leads by ESP

stop_for_company.description: Whether to stop the campaign for the entire company(domain) when a lead replies

insert_unsubscribe_header.description: Whether to insert an unsubscribe header in emails

cc_list.description: List of accounts to CC on emails

bcc_list.description: List of accounts to BCC on emails

def-2.title: Email
def-2.description: A campaign email, a reply, a manually sent email, or any other email that's visible in the Unibox

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the email was added to our database. This is not the timestamp of the email itself, since the email could have been sent at a different time. Please check the `timestamp_email` field for the timestamp of the email.

timestamp_email.description: The timestamp of the email, as provided by the email server. Please note that the timestamp is not always accurate, as it can be manipulated by the sender or the email server.

message_id.description: Unique email ID from the email server

subject.description: Subject line of the email message

from_address_email.description: The sender email address, populated based on the eaccount

to_address_email_list.description: Comma-separated list of recipient email addresses

cc_address_email_list.description: Comma-separated list of CC email addresses

bcc_address_email_list.description: Comma-separated list of BCC email addresses

body.description: An object containing the email body in HTML and text format

campaign_id.description: The id of the campaign that the email is associated with (it can be null for manually sent emails)

subsequence_id.description: The id of the campaign subsequence that the email is associated with (it can be null for manually sent emails)

list_id.description: The id of the list (if the lead is part of a list)

lead.description: The email address of the lead that the email is associated with

eaccount.description: The email account that was used to send the email. This needs to be validated to make sure it exists in the user workspace

ue_type.description: Email type based on the life cycle of the email

step.description: The campaign step that the email is associated with

is_unread.description: Indicates if the email is unread

is_auto_reply.description: Indicates if the email is an auto-reply. 0 (zero) - is false, and 1 is true

ai_assisted.description: Indicates if AI assistance was used

is_focused.description: Indicates if the email is focused (is in the primary tab in the Unibox)

i_status.description: Indicates the interest status of the email

thread_id.description: Identifier for the email thread. All the emails in the same thread have the same thread ID

content_preview.description: A short preview of the email content (usually the first few lines of the email)
content_preview.example: This is a preview of the email content.

status.description: The request status. Do not use this field to determine the verification status. Please use `verification_status` instead to check the verification status

catch_all.description: Whether this is a catch-all email address

x-enumDescriptions.false: The email is not a catch-all

credits.description: The number of verification credits available after the verification

credits_used.description: The number of verification credits used

def-4.title: Lead List
def-4.description: A list used to store leads

id.description: Unique identifier for the lead list

organization_id.description: Organization ID that owns this lead list

has_enrichment_task.description: Whether this list runs the enrichment process on every added lead or not

owned_by.description: User ID of the owner of this lead list. Defaults to the user that created the list

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the lead list was created

id.description: Unique identifier for the inbox placement test

name.description: Name of the inbox placement test

delivery_mode.description: Whether to send emails one by one or all together

description.description: Description of the inbox placement test

schedule.description: Specifies the date and time when the automated inbox placement tests will be sent.

days.description: Days of the week when the test will run, where keys are integers (0-6, 0 = Sunday) and values are booleans indicating active days.

from.description: The time of day when the test will start (24-hour format).

timing.description: Timing configuration for the scheduled test.

timezone.description: Timezone in which the schedule is set, in IANA timezone format.

type.description: Whether the inbox placement test is a one-time test or an automated test

sending_method.description: Whether the inbox placement test will be sent from Instantly or from outside Instantly

email_subject.description: Email subject of the inbox placement test

email_body.description: Email body of the inbox placement test
email_body.example: Hi, this is my email body

emails.description: Emails to send the inbox placement test to

test_code.description: Code for identifying the inbox placement tests in the email body from outside Instantly

tags.description: List of tag IDs to use for sending emails

recipients_labels.description: A list of email providers and their corresponding types to which emails will be sent. To retrieve the available options, use the `GET: /inbox-placement-tests/email-service-provider-options` endpoint

region.description: The region to send emails to

sub_region.description: The sub-region to send emails to

type.description: The type of email to send

esp.description: The Email Service Provider (ESP) to send emails to

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the inbox placement test was created

timestamp_next_run.description: Timestamp when the inbox placement test will run next

automations.description: Optional automations to trigger based on conditions

pause_sending_campaigns_for.description: Number of days to pause sending campaigns for

then.description: Actions to take when condition is met

status.description: Status of the inbox placement test

not_sending_status.description: Why the inbox placement test is currently not sending. It will be an empty string if there are no issues.

def-6.title: Inbox Placement Analytics
def-6.description: Analytics data for individual emails in inbox placement tests

id.description: Unique identifier for the inbox placement analytics entry

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the inbox placement analytics was created

timestamp_created_date.description: Date when the inbox placement analytics was created

is_spam.description: Indicates if the email landed in spam (1 for spam, 0 otherwise)

has_category.description: Indicates if the email was categorized like promotions, social, etc.

recipient_geo.description: The geographic location of the recipient

spf_pass.description: Indicates if the email passed SPF validation (1 for pass, 0 otherwise)

dkim_pass.description: Indicates if the email passed DKIM validation (1 for pass, 0 otherwise)

dmarc_pass.description: Indicates if the email passed DMARC validation (1 for pass, 0 otherwise)

smtp_ip_blacklist_report.description: Blacklist report for the SMTP IP address

authentication_failure_results.description: Details of authentication failures for SPF, DKIM, and DMARC

examples:
DKIM-Signature: v=1; a=rsa-sha256; c=relaxed/relaxed; d=gappssmtp.com; s=20161025;
 h=mime-version:from:date:message-id:subject:to; bh=ABC123; b=ABC123

def-7.title: Inbox Placement Blacklist & SpamAssassin Report
def-7.description: Report data for an inbox placement test

id.description: Unique identifier for the inbox placement report entry

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the inbox placement report was created

timestamp_created_date.description: Date when the inbox placement report was created

domain_blacklist_count.description: Count of blacklists the domain is listed on

domain.description: Domain of the inbox placement report

domain_ip_blacklist_count.description: Count of blacklists the domain IP is listed on

spam_assassin_score.description: SpamAssassin score for the email, indicating spam likelihood

is_spam.description: Indicates if the message is classified as spam by SpamAssassin

report.description: List of individual SpamAssassin rule evaluations

description.description: The section or type of the rule triggered

name.description: The name of the SpamAssassin rule

score.description: The score assigned to this rule evaluation

spam_score.description: Overall spam score assigned to the message by SpamAssassin

blacklist_report.description: Detailed blacklist report for the domain or IP

address.description: The address or domain associated with the report

blacklisted_count.description: The count of blacklists the address is listed on

is_listed.description: Whether the address is listed on this blacklist

ip.description: The IP address associated with the blacklist check

is_blacklisted.description: Overall status indicating if the address is blacklisted

is_domain.description: Whether the address is a domain

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the campaign was created

def-11.title: Lead
def-11.description: A lead entity representing an individual lead

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the lead was created

timestamp_updated.description: Timestamp when the lead was last updated

organization.description: Organization ID associated with the lead

campaign.description: Campaign ID associated with the lead

email_open_count.description: Number of times the email was opened

email_reply_count.description: Number of times the email was replied to

email_click_count.description: Number of times the email was clicked

payload.description: Lead custom variables. This object can contain any key, but the values have to be of type string, number, boolean, or null. We do NOT allow objects or arrays as values.

examples: Hi {{first_name}}, I noticed you work at {{company_name}}...

status_summary_subseq.description: Subsequence status summary of the lead

last_step_timestamp_executed.description: Timestamp when the last step was executed

email_opened_step.description: Last email step opened by the lead

email_opened_variant.description: Last step variant opened by the lead

email_replied_step.description: Last email step the lead has replied to

email_replied_variant.description: Last step variant the lead has replied to

email_clicked_step.description: Last email step the lead has clicked

email_clicked_variant.description: Last step variant the lead has clicked

lt_interest_status.description: Lead interest status. It can be either a static value (check below), or a custom status interest value

timestamp_added_subsequence.description: Timestamp when the lead was added to the subsequence

timestamp_last_contact.description: Timestamp of the last contact with the lead

timestamp_last_open.description: Timestamp of the last email open

timestamp_last_reply.description: Timestamp of the last email reply

timestamp_last_interest_change.description: Timestamp of the last interest status change

timestamp_last_click.description: Timestamp of the last email click

list_id.description: List ID associated with the lead

uploaded_by_user.description: ID of the user who uploaded the lead

upload_method.description: Method used to upload the lead

assigned_to.description: ID of the user assigned to the lead

is_website_visitor.description: Indicates if the lead is a website visitor

timestamp_last_touch.description: Timestamp of the last touch with the lead

esp_code.description: ESP code associated with the lead

def-12.title: Background Job
def-12.description: A background job that can be used to perform long-running tasks

id.description: Unique identifier for the background job

user_id.description: The id of the user that triggered the action that created the job

entity_id.description: The id of the entity that the job is related to

x-enumDescriptions.list: The entity is a lead list

data.description: Data about the job, used to store any additional information we need to process the job

progress.description: Progress of the job as a percentage (from 0 to 100)

x-enumDescriptions.pending: The background job is waiting in the queue to be processed
x-enumDescriptions.in-progress: The background job is being processed
x-enumDescriptions.success: The background job has been successfully processed

created_at.description: Timestamp when the job was created

updated_at.description: Timestamp when the job was last updated

def-13.title: Custom Tag
def-13.description: A custom tag for organizing and categorizing accounts and campaigns. You can use them as filters in apis that list accounts and campaigns.

id.description: Unique identifier for the custom tag

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the custom tag was created

timestamp_updated.description: Timestamp when the custom tag was last updated

organization_id.description: Organization ID that owns this custom tag

label.description: Display label for the custom tag

description.description: Detailed description of the custom tag purpose

id.description: Unique identifier for the block list entry

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the block list entry was created

organization_id.description: Organization ID that owns this block list entry

bl_value.description: The email or domain to block

is_domain.description: Whether this entry blocks an entire domain

def-15.title: Lead Label
def-15.description: A custom label for categorizing and managing leads

id.description: Unique identifier for the custom lead label

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the custom lead label was created

created_by.description: User ID of the creator of this label

organization_id.description: Organization ID that owns this custom lead label

label.description: Display label for the custom lead label

interest_status_label.description: Interest status label associated with this label

interest_status.description: Interest status associated with this label. This is generated automatically by us.

description.description: Detailed description of the custom lead label purpose

use_with_ai.description: Whether this label should be used with AI features

def-19.title: Workspace
def-19.description: A workspace entity representing a workspace

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the workspace was created

timestamp_updated.description: Timestamp when the workspace was last updated

owner.description: User ID of the workspace owner

add_unsub_to_block.description: Whether to add unsubscribes to block list

org_client_domain.description: The domain for the white label agency mode

plan_id_website_visitor.description: Plan ID for website visitor tracking

def-22.title: Workspace Group Member
def-22.description: A member of a workspace group. You can use the endpoints within this entity to manage the members of a workspace group.

id.description: The unique identifier of the workspace group member

admin_workspace_id.description: The id of the admin workspace

sub_workspace_id.description: The id of the sub workspace

x-enumDescriptions.pending: The member has been invited to the workspace group but has not yet accepted the invitation.
x-enumDescriptions.accepted: The member has accepted the invitation to the workspace group.
x-enumDescriptions.rejected: The member has rejected the invitation to the workspace group.

sub_workspace_name.description: The name of the sub workspace.

admin_workspace_name.description: The name of the admin workspace.

def-23.title: Workspace Member
def-23.description: A member of a workspace with associated user details

id.description: Unique identifier for the workspace member

email.description: Email address of the workspace member

user_id.description: User ID of the workspace member

role.description: THe role of the workspace member defining their access level. While the "owner" role is listed in the enum, it cannot be created via the API, and is only assigned to the user who creates the workspace.

x-enumDescriptions.owner: Owner - Full access and workspace management
x-enumDescriptions.admin: Admin - Full access except workspace deletion
x-enumDescriptions.editor: Editor - Can edit but not manage workspace settings
x-enumDescriptions.client: This is a special role for users in the whitelabel (agency) view. It is not available in the API.

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the workspace member was created

workspace_id.description: ID of the workspace this member belongs to

accepted.description: Whether the member has accepted the workspace invitation

issuer_id.description: ID of the user who added this member to the workspace

def-24.title: Campaign Subsequence
def-24.description: A subsequence entity representing a follow-up sequence

timestamp_created.description: Timestamp when the subsequence was created

workspace.description: ID of the workspace this subsequence belongs to

x-enumDescriptions.0: Draft - The subsequence is in draft mode and not yet active
x-enumDescriptions.1: Active - The subsequence is currently running
x-enumDescriptions.2: Paused - The subsequence has been manually paused
x-enumDescriptions.3: Completed - The subsequence has finished running
x-enumDescriptions.4: Running Subsequences - The subsequence has active child sequences
x-enumDescriptions.-99: Account Suspended - The subsequence is suspended due to account issues
x-enumDescriptions.-1: Accounts Unhealthy - The subsequence is paused due to unhealthy sending accounts
x-enumDescriptions.-2: Bounce Protection - The subsequence is paused due to high bounce rates

timestamp_leads_updated.description: Timestamp when the leads were last updated

sequences.description: List of sequences (the actual email copy). Even though this field is an array, only the first element is used, so please provide only one array item, and add the steps to that array

type.description: Type of step. This has to be 'email' always - it's the only supported type for now

delay.description: The number of days to wait before sending the NEXT email

body.example:
Hey {{firstName}},

I hope you are doing well.

v_disabled.description: Whether this variant is disabled. By default, all the variants are enabled. Please set this to true if you want to disable this variant

def-30.title: Audit Log
def-30.description: Audit log records for tracking system activities

organization_id.description: Organization ID associated with the activity

user_agent.description: User agent of the client that performed the activity

user_id.description: ID of the user who performed the activity

ip_address.description: IP address from which the activity was performed

from_api.description: Whether the activity was performed via API

affected_count.description: Number of items affected by the activity

user_name.description: Name of the user who performed the activity

post.description:
Send a reply to an email. This endpoint can be used to send an email only as a reply to an existing email. In order to reply to an email, please specify the `reyply_to_uuid` field, and your email will be sent as a reply to that email. The `reyply_to_uuid` field represents the `id` field of an existing email, which is being returned to you in all the `/email` endpoints


Requires one of the following scopes: `emails:create`, `emails:all`, `all:create`, `all:all`

text.description: Text body of the email message

post.description:
This endpoint allows you to send an invitation for a sub workspace to join the admin workspace. The sub workspace will be added as a sub workspace of the admin workspace only if the sub workspace owner accepts the invitation.


Requires one of the following scopes: `workspace_group_members:create`, `workspace_group_members:all`, `all:create`, `all:all`
